course.subject: SBMT
course.name: Social Enterprise Internship Program
course.description: The course is intended to give business undergraduate students an opportunity to gain exposure in the area of social entrepreneurship and apply their knowledge to solve real-world challenges facing these organizations.  It is conducted in the form of an internship program at a designated social enterprise under the supervision of the School of Business and Management.  Approval from the course coordinator is needed prior to enrolling in the course.  Graded P or F. Students may repeat the course for credits if different topics are taken.
